com.isoterik.mgdx.m2d.components

Class SpriteRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.isoterik.mgdx.Component
      • com.isoterik.mgdx.m2d.components.SpriteRenderer

  • public class SpriteRenderer
extends Component
    GameObjects that needs to render sprites (Texture or TextureRegion) should attach this component.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.isoterik.mgdx.Component

        enabled, gameObject, input, scene

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpriteRenderer

        public SpriteRenderer(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion sprite,
                      WorldUnits worldUnits)
        Creates a new instance given a sprite and WorldUnits to use for converting the sprite dimension to world units.
        Parameters:
        sprite - an instance of TextureRegion
        worldUnits - an instance of WorldUnits

      • SpriteRenderer

        public SpriteRenderer(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture sprite,
                      WorldUnits worldUnits)
        Creates a new instance given a TextureRegion and WorldUnits to use for converting the sprite dimension to world units. Note: the entire Texture will be used as the sprite. This constructor isn't useful if the Texture is a sprite sheet (atlas)
        Parameters:
        sprite - an instance of Texture
        worldUnits - an instance of WorldUnits

    • Method Detail

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(boolean visible)
        Changes the visibility of the sprite. Note: this only affects the sprite and not the game object itself
        Parameters:
        visible - whether sprite should be rendered or not

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible()
        Returns:
        whether sprite is currently rendered or not

      • setCull

        public void setCull(boolean cull)
        Whether this sprite should be culled. When enabled, sprite will be rendered only if the game object can be seen by the camera. This significantly reduces processor load. It is enabled by default
        Parameters:
        cull - whether culling should be enabled for this renderer

      • isCull

        public boolean isCull()
        Returns:
        whether culling is enabled

      • setSprite

        public void setSprite(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion sprite,
                      WorldUnits worldUnits)
        Sets the sprite (TextureRegion) for this renderer. The host game object will be resized to fit the dimensions of the sprite. The WorldUnits given will be used for converting the sprite dimension to world units.
        Parameters:
        sprite - an instance of TextureRegion
        worldUnits - an instance of WorldUnits

      • setSprite

        public void setSprite(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion sprite)
        Sets the sprite (TextureRegion) for this renderer. The host game object will be resized to fit the dimensions of the sprite. The default WorldUnits provided during construction will be used for converting the sprite dimension to world units.
        Parameters:
        sprite - an instance of TextureRegion

      • getSprite

        public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion getSprite()
        Returns:
        the sprite used for rendering

      • setColor

        public void setColor(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color color)
        Use this to tint the color of the rendered sprite. Setting the color to Color.WHITE renders the original sprite with no tint
        Parameters:
        color - the color to used for tinting the sprite

      • getColor

        public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color getColor()
        Returns:
        the color to used for tinting the sprite

      • setOpacity

        public void setOpacity(float opacity)
        Sets the opacity of the rendered sprite on a scale of (0 - 1) where 0 means 0% opaque (completely transparent) and 1 means 100% opaque
        Parameters:
        opacity - the opacity

      • getOpacity

        public float getOpacity()
        Returns:
        the opacity of the rendered sprite

      • setFlipX

        public void setFlipX(boolean flipX)
        Determines whether the sprite should be flipped horizontally. Useful for mirroring sprites
        Parameters:
        flipX - whether the sprite should be flipped horizontally

      • isFlipX

        public boolean isFlipX()
        Returns:
        whether the sprite is flipped horizontally

      • setFlipY

        public void setFlipY(boolean flipY)
        Determines whether the sprite should be flipped vertically. Useful for mirroring sprites
        Parameters:
        flipY - whether the sprite should be flipped vertically

      • isFlipY

        public boolean isFlipY()
        Returns:
        whether the sprite is flipped vertically

      • setWorldSize

        public void setWorldSize()
        Converts the dimensions of the sprite to world units then use it as the dimension for the host game object. The origin is also shifted to the center of the game object. No change is made if there is currently no host game object.

      • attach

        public void attach()
        Once this component is attached, the host game object will be resized to fit the dimensions of the sprite. Called when the component is attached to a GameObject. Note: At this point it is guaranteed that a game object exists for this component but it is not guaranteed that the game object has been added to a Scene yet!
        Overrides:
        attach in class Component

      • render

        public void render(GameCamera gameCamera)
        Description copied from class: Component
        Called when the component should render.
        Overrides:
        render in class Component
        Parameters:
        gameCamera - the camera used by the scene

      • drawSprite

        protected void drawSprite(GameCamera gameCamera)
        Renders the sprite to the screen.
        Parameters:
        gameCamera - the camera used by the scene where the host game object resides
